Package main

Class DatabaseConnection

java.lang.Object
main.DatabaseConnection
public final class DatabaseConnection extends Object
Class used to handle all connections and querries to and from the database.

  • Constructor Details

    • DatabaseConnection

      public DatabaseConnection()

  • Method Details

    • Connection

      public void Connection()
      Connection method to run at the start of every query and request of the database. Handles the connection between the ToDo.db and this application

    • ExecuteUpdate

      public void ExecuteUpdate(String execQuery)
      Database method to send an update query (no results or returns from the database) from the application to the ToDo database.

      This primarily handles all 'INSERT', 'UPDATE' and 'DELETE' SQLite methods

      Parameters:
      execQuery - - A formatted string containing the query to run on the database

    • ExecuteRequest

      public ResultSet ExecuteRequest(String execRequest)
      Database method to send a request query (A result is returned from the database) from the application to the ToDo database.

      This only handles all 'SELECT' statment SQLite methods and returns them in a java.sql.ResultSet

      Parameters:
      execRequest - - A Formatted string containing the query to run on the database
      Returns:
      - The results of the sent query

    • SelectAllTasks

      public ResultSet SelectAllTasks()
      Database method that creates the request to retrieve all tasks currently stored in the database.
      Returns:
      - A ResultSet containing all records in the database
      See Also:
      • ExecuteRequest(java.lang.String)

    • DeleteTask

      public void DeleteTask(int id)
      Database method that creates a query to delete a task currently stored in the database
      Parameters:
      id - - The task identifier/primary key that you wish to delete
      See Also:
      • ExecuteUpdate(java.lang.String)

    • CreateTask

      public void CreateTask(int id, String taskName)
      Database method that creates a query to insert a task with the bare amount of information required (primary id and the task's name)
      Parameters:
      id - - The primary key for the created task
      taskName - - The task's name
      See Also:
      • ExecuteUpdate(java.lang.String)

    • CreateTask

      public void CreateTask(int id, String taskName, String details)
      Database method that creates a query to insert a task containing primary id, the task's name, and any pertinant task details

      id - - The primary key for the created task
      taskName - - The task's name
      details - - The task's details

    • CreateTask

      Parameters:

      taskName - - The task's name
      date - - The due date for the task

      Parameters:

      taskName - - The task's name
      details - - The task's details
      date - - The due date for the task

    • CloseConnection

      public void CloseConnection()
      Database method to close the database connection

    • TaskCreated

      public void TaskCreated(int id, LocalDate date, String... created)
      Override method to implement the TaskCreated TaskListener interface

      On a task being created in the application a version/relica of the task needs to be created in the database. This method takes all the information about the created task object and sends a relevant 'INSERT' query to the database

      Parameters:
      id - - The identifier and new primary key of the task being replicated
      date - - The due date of the task (is null if has not been set/provided)
      created - - A String array that contains either the task name or the task name and task details

    • TaskUpdated

      public void TaskUpdated(int id, String... updates)
      Override method to implement the TaskUpdated TaskListener interface

      On a task being updated in the application, the version/replica of the task in the database also needs to be updated. This method takes all the updated information about a task object and sends a relevant 'UPDATE' query to the database

      Parameters:
      id - - The matching primary key for the replica in the database
      updates - - A String array that contains either the task name, task details, task due date, or all three/a combination of two of them

    • TaskDeleted

      public void TaskDeleted(int taskId)
      Override method to implement the TaskDeleted TaskListener interface

      On a task being deleted in the application, the verion/replica of the task in the database also need to be deleted. This method sends a 'DELETE' update query to the database

      Parameters:
      taskId - - The primary key of the task to be deleted
